review: Overall the Chromecast is a good purchase. I was going to get a roku, but I liked the idea of not having an extra remote and the portability of the Chromecast (ability to move from room to room in the house). Streams well, but works better with some devices than others. For instance, I have a Samsung Chromebook that I thought would be a flawless pairing- not so much. With the Samsung Chromebook particularly the video streaming is slow and commands are significantly delayed. Using and iphone or ipad works great though. Also I don't t like how it needs to be plugged into a power source on top of being plugged into the tv. Gets annoying with sparse outlets. All things considered, you can beat the price.
author: Landon M. Ford

review: Now watching movies on the big TV screen selected through HBO GO on my mobile phone, or YouTube videos found on the iPad … best 30 something $ ever spend.

review: Purchased this as a Christmas present for my Dad and he absolutely loves it.  It is very easy to use.  He has been able to watch HBO TO GO, YouTube, and Netflix on any TV in high definition using his iPhone and Chromecast.

review: In Canada, this device works primarily to play Netflix and Youtube.  It does it well, controlled by either my iPod or my computer.  As an added bonus, I can "cast" webpages I'm looking at to the screen.  It can do more in the US ... but I was simply looking for something inexpensive that plays Netflix with better picture image than my Wii and it does it well for the price.
